block.p: Fosca Francesca Piomelli, the daughter of Maria Rosaria Piomelli-Ambrosi of Sleepy Hollow, N.Y., and Dr. Sergio Piomelli of New York, was married yesterday to William Shackleton White, the son of Doris Shackleton Sommer of Damascus, Md., and William R. White of Reston, Va. The Rev. Gregory Maturi performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception in Sleepy Hollow.

Mrs. White, 26, is an associate at Kaye, Scholer, Fierman, Hays & Handler, the international law firm based in New York. She received bachelor's and law degrees from New York University. Her mother and stepfather, Vincenzo Ambrosi, own Vier Inc., an architectural design and construction company in Sleepy Hollow. Her mother is also a professor of architecture at the City University of New York. Her father is the director of pediatric hematology at the Babies and Children's Hospital of New York-Presbyterian Hospital. The bride is the stepdaughter of Mercedes Piomelli.

Her father is the director of pediatric hematology at the Babies and Children's Hospital of New York-Presbyterian Hospital. The bride is the stepdaughter of Mercedes Piomelli.

Mr. White, 27, graduated from the Georgia Institute of Technology and on Tuesday is to receive M.B.A. and law degrees from Columbia University. In August, he is to become an associate in the real estate investment-banking group of Lehman Brothers in New York. His mother is the director of the Institute for Advanced Montessori Studies at Barrie School in Silver Springs, Md. His father is a partner in Russin & Vechi, a Washington law firm. The bridegroom is the stepson of Susan White and of Richard Somer.
The bridegroom is a great-grand-nephew of Sir Ernest Shackleton, the Antarctic explorer.
